text: Post - weaning diarrhea is usually associated with the proliferation of one or more strains of β - hemolytic ETEC in the small intestine of pigs , in particular those that express fimbrial adhesins F4 ( K88 ) or F18 [ 2 ] . Thus , small intestinal epithelial cell adhesion and subsequent colonization by ETEC is mediated by F4 - or F18 - specific receptors ( F4R or F18R ) , the existence and function of which are crucial in determining the susceptibility of pigs to ETEC infection [ 2 , 7 ] . The genetic predisposition of the pig is primordial for the development of PWD [ 28 ] .
